posts.post_content:
This guy just replaced [Savra, Queen of the Golgari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savra, Queen of the Golgari) as the general of my Saproling EDH deck. (Sorry, I refuse to call it Commander.) This allowed me to splash in white. All you naysayers seem to forget how EASY it is to get a stupid amount of +1/+1 counters on your creatures, [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) not withstanding. [Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger) and the ultimate powerhouse, [Primordial Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primordial Hydra). The Hydra will start making more +1/+1 counters per turn than you are capable of using!  
  
Also, since I was able to add in [Rhys the Redeemed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhys the Redeemed), the shenanigans have just gotten even worse. As long as you have a reliable untap ability, like [Patron of the Orochi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Patron of the Orochi) and [Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse), Rhys can double your saprolings on EVERY PLAYER'S TURN. With [Juniper Order Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Juniper Order Ranger) in play, as well as an excellent mana source like [Gaea's Cradle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaea's Cradle), you can m... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Although using Ghave as a Commander in a fungus deck might not be extremely effective, it's fun for casual, he creates ridiculous numbers of Saprolings and then the fungi sac them for fun abilities, Regeneration, card draw, direct damage, haste, +/+ abilities. Mycologist or elvish farmer both give life gain.

posts.post_content:
Oh my...the shenanigans that will come online with the release of Avacyn Restored! Check Cathars' Crusade and Champion of Lambolt.   
  
If you have Ghave, [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar) and those two out on the battlefield, you essentially have infinite, infinite/ infinite unblockable saproling tokens.   
  
Also, [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) will like Cathars' Crusade...a lot. So will [Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vish Kal, Blood Arbiter).  
  
Ghave EDH just got crazy...again.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Want to go infinite? Play a [Priest of Gix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Priest of Gix) and [Undying Evil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undying Evil) it. Then, if you're really nasty, put in a [Cathar's Crusade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cathar's Crusade).  
  
In fact, even without the infinite the crusade is nuts with this guy. Just use it either way.  
  
And anything that has undying has quite literally become undying.
posts.html:

Eeyup... This guy here has made my playgroup play a biiiiit more carefully..  
BECAUSE I AM THE COMBO NOODLER!!!!!!!!!  
Ghave + Utopia Mycon/Phyrexian Altar/Ashnod's Altar + Doubling Season/Parallel Lives + Lumberknot/Champion of Lambholt/Cathar's Crusade/Mortician Beetle/Sigil Captain = Infinite mana, infinite counters.   
And what do I do with that?  
Well...  
Mentor of the Meek/Psychotrope Thallid/Skullclamp: Draw my deck  
Soul Warden: Gain ALL of the life  
Aura Shards/Butcher of Malakir/Spike Tiller: Empty the field of everything and ask if they'd like to scoop  
(in my defence, I only did that once and swore never to do so again... ya know, mad with power :)  
  
Or if it's time to end it...  
Thoughtpicker Witch/Extractor Demon: Mill out, they lose come their draw step  
Blasting Station/Triskelion: Death of a thousand stings!  
  
I love going infinite, and all teh ridiculous power that comes with it!

posts.post_content: How has no one caught onto incorporating proliferate with this guy? The wording states "choose any number of target permanents or players with counters on them." All of your creatures can be targets for proliferation. It doesn't even limit the kind of counters-- +1/+1, fungus, infect counters on your opponents/ their creatures, whatever. [Contagion Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contagion Engine) becomes both offensive and defensive, and it grows your army exponentially.
posts.html:
How has no one caught onto incorporating proliferate with this guy? The wording states "choose any number of target permanents or players with counters on them." All of your creatures can be targets for proliferation. It doesn't even limit the kind of counters-- +1/+1, fungus, infect counters on your opponents/ their creatures, whatever. Contagion Engine becomes both offensive and defensive, and it grows your army exponentially.

Posted By: LordRandomness (5/19/2013 4:50:05 AM)

posts.post_content: Going is infinite is one thing, making busted 2 card combos is slightly better since its more consistant. Not saying going infinite is not doable just seems easier fetching a single card and abusing the synergy out of it than setting up a 3 card combo which is a tad fragile. [Ivy Lane Denizen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivy Lane Denizen) means for 1 mana you produce a 1/1 without loss. My personal favorite is comboing with [Vhati il-Dal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vhati il-Dal) - they attack, you spam a 1/1 and make the attacking creature a toughness of 1 and just chump... not even just vhati and [Deathspore Thallid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathspore Thallid). The trick with Ghave is not only to include cards that combo with it but make sure those cards can combo with each other.
posts.html:
Going is infinite is one thing, making busted 2 card combos is slightly better since its more consistant. Ivy Lane Denizen means for 1 mana you produce a 1/1 without loss.
